intro: Crotalaria eremicola, commonly known as the desert crownflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant has small, hairy leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Crotalaria eremicola plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native environment.
